oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1956-08-25 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from August 25, 1956. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Roy Acuff (host/performer) with his Smoky Mountain Boys, guest performers Johnnie & Jack with Ruby Wells and Kitty Wells, and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Pap's Jug Band, June Carter, and Bashful Brother Oswald. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Rod Brasfield; Johnnie & Jack; Ruby Wells; Howdy Forrester; Pap's Jug Band
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Roy Acuff -- Y'All Come (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Roy Acuff) -- Roy Acuff introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Roy Acuff) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Roy Acuff) -- Roy Acuff introduces Johnnie & Jack and Ruby Wells -- Love, Love, Love (Johnnie & Jack, Ruby Wells) -- Roy Acuff introduces Howdy Forrester -- Sally Gooden (Howdy Forrester fiddle) -- Roy Acuff talks -- I'll Fly Away (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Roy Acuff) -- Prince Albert jingle -- Roy Acuff introduces the Jug Band -- Thirty Days (Pap's Jug Band)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Brasfield, Rod; Bashful Brother Oswald; Pap's Jug Band; Forrester, Howdy, 1922-1987; Acuff, Roy; Johnnie & Jack; Wright, Johnnie, 1914-2011; Wright, Ruby (Vocalist); Anglin, Jack, 1916-1963; Wells, Kitty; Wells, Ruby; Smoky Mountain Boys; Riddle, Jimmy, 1918-1982; Cash, June Carter, 1929-2003
